attributes.action: Abandon plans to build a Garden Bridge in London
attributes.additional_details:
The proposed garden bridge from Temple to the South Bank in London is an unnecessarily expensive vanity project and should be abandoned.

At the very least it should not get any money from central government either for its construction or any ongoing maintenance costs as by the nature of its design it will only be used by a tiny minority of the British public - regardless of whether visiting from the regions or living in the area.
